text: Anouk Aimée (; 27 April 1932 - 18 June 2024) was a French movie actress. She has appeared in 70 movie, starting in 1947. She was known for her movie role as Maddalena in La Dolce Vita (1960). She won a Golden Globe Award and a BAFTA Award. She was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Actress for her role in the 1966 movie A Man and a Woman. She converted to Judaism when she was an adult.jwa.org Aimée died at her home in Paris on 18 June 2024, at the age of 92. == References == ==Other websites== * * * AIMÉE Anouk International Who's Who. accessed 1 September 2006. * Sandy Flitterman-Lewis, Anouk Aimée, Jewish Women Encyclopedia * Photographs and literature Category:1932 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Actors from Paris Category:BAFTA Award winning actors Category:Converts to Judaism Category:French Jews Category:French movie actors Category:French television actors Category:Golden Globe Award winning actors Category:Jewish actors
title: Anouk Aimée
